widget.name: add
widget.tooltip: Add a new tunnel to the list above using the information below.

widget.name: update
widget.tooltip: Update the selected tunnel with the information changed below.

widget.name: delete
widget.tooltip: Delete the selected tunnel.

widget.name: start
widget.tooltip: Start the selected tunnel. (you may also double-click the tunnel in the list above)

widget.name: stop
widget.tooltip: Stop the selected tunnel.

widget.name: label12
widget.label: Your local name for the tunnel

widget.name: label13
widget.label: Host name or IP address of PPTP server

widget.name: name
widget.tooltip: Your local name for the tunnel, such as 'work', or 'adsl', used to create the file in /etc/ppp/peers

widget.name: server
widget.tooltip: Host name or IP address of the PPTP server that this tunnel is to connect to. This is given to the pptp command.

widget.name: domain
widget.tooltip: An optional domain name for authentication, usually required only if the PPTP server is running on a Microsoft Windows system.

widget.name: username
widget.tooltip: Username provided for you by the administrator of the PPTP server.

widget.name: password
widget.tooltip: Password provided by the administrator of the PPTP server.

widget.name: routing_interface_only
widget.tooltip: creates a route to the PPTP server, but otherwise makes no changes
widget.label: Interface Only

widget.name: routing_all_to_tunnel
widget.tooltip: replaces the default route so that all network traffic flows through the tunnel
widget.label: All to Tunnel

widget.name: routing_lan_to_lan
widget.tooltip: adds a route to the networks listed on the right, and adds iptables rules to allow hosts on your local area network to connect via NAT to the remote tunneled network
widget.label: LAN to LAN

widget.name: routing_client_to_lan
widget.tooltip: adds a route to the networks listed on the right, all other traffic continues to use your existing network connection
widget.label: Client to LAN

widget.name: frame2
widget.label: Routes To Be Added Via Tunnel

widget.name: resolv
widget.tooltip: IP addresses of domain name servers to use inside the tunnelled network, leave blank to not change /etc/resolv.conf, otherwise list them space separated.

widget.name: usepeerdns
widget.tooltip: Ask the peer (the PPTP server) for DNS server addresses to use.
widget.label: Automatic

widget.name: dns-options
widget.tooltip: Additional lines to be added to /etc/resolv.conf when the tunnel is connected, use a semicolon between each line.

widget.name: nomppe-40
widget.tooltip: During MPPE negotiation, refuses to accept 40-bit encryption.
widget.label: Refuse 40-bit Encryption

widget.name: nomppe-128
widget.tooltip: During MPPE negotiation, refuses to accept 128-bit encryption.
widget.label: Refuse 128-bit Encryption

widget.name: mppe-stateful
widget.tooltip: Stateless encryption allows the tunnel to continue decryption without requiring the retransmission of missing packets.
widget.label: Refuse Stateless Encryption

widget.name: require-mppe
widget.tooltip: Terminates the connection if MPPE cannot be negotiated. May be required for successful connection to some servers.
widget.label: Require Microsoft Point-to-Point Encryption (MPPE)

widget.name: refuse-eap
widget.tooltip: Refuse to use the EAP (extensible authentication protocol?) to authenticate ourselves to the server; this is set by default until pppd supports MPPE with EAP
widget.label: Refuse to Authenticate with EAP

widget.name: autostart
widget.tooltip: When pptpconfig starts, and loads the tunnels you have defined, then this tunnel will be started. This is not a pppd option.
widget.label: Start tunnel when this program starts

widget.name: persist
widget.tooltip: Do not exit after a connection is terminated; instead try to reopen the connection.
widget.label: Reconnect if disconnected

widget.name: debug
widget.tooltip: Enables connection debugging facilities. If this option is given, pppd will log the contents of all control packets sent or received in a readable form.
widget.label: Enable connection debugging facilities

widget.name: pppd-options
widget.tooltip: Additional options that will be given to the pppd program, see 'man pppd' for the complete list.

widget.name: pptp-options
widget.tooltip: Additional options that will be given to the pptp program, see 'man pptp' for the complete list.

widget.name: iconify
widget.tooltip: When the tunnel has connected, iconify (minimise) this window and the tunnel window. This is not a pppd option.
widget.label: Iconify this program on connect

widget.name: close
widget.tooltip: Close program, leaving tunnels to run
widget.label: Quit

widget.name: label28
widget.label: Network Routes To Be Added Via Tunnel

widget.name: add
widget.tooltip: add the route (below) to the list (above)

widget.name: delete
widget.tooltip: delete the selected route in the list above

widget.name: network
widget.tooltip: The network to which a route is to be created, in the CIDR form address/bits, for example 10.2.0.0/16

widget.name: tunnel_save_as
widget.tooltip: Saves the complete log into a file so that you can attach it to an e-mail.
widget.label: Save As ...

widget.name: start
widget.tooltip: start the tunnel

widget.name: ping
widget.tooltip: Test the connection to the PPTP server using the ping command. This pings the remote IP address assigned by the server.

widget.name: stop
widget.tooltip: stop the tunnel

widget.name: close
widget.tooltip: Close this window, leaving tunnel as it is
widget.label: Close
